title: Box, Box, 19th century
provenance: MMA Number (15.95.12) Lockwood de Forest (American, New York 1850–1932 Santa Barbara, California), New York (until 1915; sold to MMA)
creditline: Lent by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Gift of Robert W. and Lockwood de Forest, 1919 (19.135.12)
description: Tri-lobate form, with scroll decoration and centered by a rosette.
gallery_text: This box exemplifies the fine level of filigree metalwork still available when de Forest travelled in India.
label_text: This box exemplifies the fine level of filigree metalwork still available when de Forest travelled in India.

tombstone.epitaph:
Box, Box, 19th century. Filigree silver. 
Lent by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Gift of Robert W. and Lockwood de Forest, 1919 (19.135.12). 3.2012.3.
